thread.title: EastEnders' Charlie Slater to make a brief return to Albert Square in the new year
thread.title_full: EastEnders' Charlie Slater to make a brief return to Albert Square in the new year

title: EastEnders' Charlie Slater to make a brief return to Albert Square in the new year
text:
EastEnders' Charlie Slater to make a brief return to Albert Square in the new year EastEnders' Charlie Slater to make a brief return to Albert Square in the new year 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Derek Martin is to make a brief return to EastEnders in 2016, reprising his role as Charlie Slater. 
The 82-year-old actor will be making a guest appearance in the new year, closely following the return of on-screen daughter Kat Moon (Jessie Wallace). Derek Martin plays Charlie Slater (Jane Mingay/PA) 
It was announced earlier this week that Kat and Alfie Moon would be making a temporary appearance in Albert Square this Christmas, and it is expected that Derek’s return will stir up more ghosts from the family’s past. 
The former Eldorado actor said: “I’m so excited to be coming back into such a big and important storyline and I can’t wait to get stuck in and be back with the family again.” EastEnders’ Kat and Alfie (BBC) 
Martin, who originally starred in EastEnders in 2000, has returned to the soap several times before – notably in 2011 and 2013. Share article 
His return is part of a storyline that will see Kat and Alfie head off to Ireland to search for answers to “some very big questions”. Promoted Stories
